Frenzied rats accompany the pack that carries the unholy icon on the Horned Rat and that of the Under-Empire itself.
This magnificent standard is emblazoned with the glittering image of the World Dragon - a symbol of mighty Ulthuan.
Rituals of skittering urgency allow this banner to deliver a surge of energy to the unit carrying it.
Such is the supernatural fear instilled by the visage of the Bloody-handed God upon this standard that few dare to even look at it.

colour_text: This banner is a colossal totem trophy rack. It screams to be looked at, so that other clans might be impressed or cowed.
A portion of the boundless energy of the Old One Huanchi resides in this totem, giving its bearers an unnatural burst of speed.
Imbued with the magic of Hekarti the Hydra Queen, this banner quickens the reflexes so that those nearby strike with her own speed and savagery.
An aura of courage fills the hearts of those who serve under this banner, making them each as fierce as a lion!

	(assigned unit)

colour_text: A banner depicting the dread city. Under the mystical influence of this serpentine banner, warriors strike with astounding speed.
Beams of intense sunlight streaming from this standard make it all but impossible to look upon. Those who do stare too long will be blinded.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Sunburst Standard of Hexoatl"
	(assigned unit)

colour_text: The animal spirit of the jaguar is represented with this standard. Those in the shadow of this jungle beast hunt down their enemies with relentless ferocity and persistence.
This totem causes those who look upon it to realise their own mortality - the futility of their own small lives within the grand scheme of the Old Ones washes over them.

This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

colour_text: This enchanted talisman is carved from the heart of the largest black tree in the Petrified Forest.
Though the Amulet of Fire constantly flickers with pale flames, the wearer is never burned, and is more resistant to magic.
The bearer of this amethyst amulet knows things no mortal should.
A dark crown, that will ensorcel the heart of those that bear it.
Made from gold of the Blackspine Mountains, the Deathmask depicts Khaine in his aspect of the Deathbringer.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

colour_text: The Emerald Collar is a gold band encrusted with cursed stones.
These pendants are tokens in the form of a simple rat skull strung upon an iron chain. They are 'gifts' from the Council of Thirteen.
An ancient and potent token of protection this necklace wards off attacks and those of spiteful intent.
Few wear the Golden Crown for long; the souls of the dead hang heavy about its brow, despite considerable arcane protections.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

colour_text: Billowing black smoke emerges from the opal set into this ring, obscuring the wearer's position.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

colour_text: The size of the artefact known as the Talisman of Saphery belies its power, negating the effects of enchanted weapons against the bearer.
The amulet is a lustrous polished stone with a midnight hue, engraved with a single spiteful rune.
These golden bracers are fabled to have been found on the shores of distant Lustria and are inscribed with unusual glyphs.
A single green gem adorns the hilt and a terrible poison is smeared upon its blade.
This sword has been left for thirteen days in the dreaded Cauldron of One Thousand Poxes; now a foul green fluid drips from its edge.
Bright blue steel can be enchanted to hold spells of great speed and deadly accuracy; the Elves of Ulthuan are masters of such magic.
To the valiant, this blade lends supernatural speed and vigour; to the craven and corrupt, it brings only swift death.
Smeared with special ointments of the Plaguelords, even a scratch from this blade can cause a lethal infection.
Said to be the weapon wielded by the Old One Tzunki, this exquisitely crafted weapon is unbreakable and hums as it cuts through the air.
The Blade of Ruin is not one to be wielded lightly; its owner stands to lose as much as its victim.
This gleaming blade is found in the watery depths and honed by crashing waves. It strikes with the unstoppable power of the sea itself.
An acrid smell of sulphur exudes from its barbed blades.
A dire lance, etched with the fiery blood of Dragons. It is much feared by High Elf Princes from the realm of Caledor.
This mace has a life of its own; it strikes out with lightning speed to bite enemy weapons before a blow is struck.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +50%

colour_text: This halberd was carried by Lord Khalak of Ghrond, the first Captain of the Black Guard. It has been passed down to every successor since.
Created by Hotek, a renegade priest of Vaul, this blade of obsidian allows the wielder to strike with blinding speed.
This ceremonial dagger has taken thousands of sacrifices to the bloodthirsty Sotek, but there is always a need for more…

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -6 for Skaven units
	(local region)

colour_text: A terrible weapon - a lance tipped with a blade carved from Cold One teeth, that leaves ragged wounds ensuring victims bleed painfully to death.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +50%
Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against Dwarfs

colour_text: A Skaven weapon forged specifically for killing the hated Beard-things. Die-die!

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +5 when fighting against Dwarfs

colour_text: A large, bladed weapon bound with spells of dismemberment.
This twisted blade was taken from the body of a Chaos Champion. Why he should have carried it not known, along with the name of his Elven slayer.
Heartseeker has an uncanny ability to find the heart of a living thing. Dark Elves delight in its ability to destroy the lifeforce of their victims.
Woe to those who fall within its grasp, for the claw is strong enough to crush a Troll's skull.
An unspeakably powerful weapon once said to have been wielded by the warlike Old One deity, Tlanxla.
Forged by fallen Priests of Vaul and fuelled by the blood of sacrificial victims.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Wither Upgraded"
Hero capacity: +1 for Plague Priests and Eshin Sorcerers

colour_text: As light as a dagger, this curved blade invigorates the wielder with the power of the sun, fuelling his charge with fiery vigour.
An exquisite  sword forged from minerals found in the sea; no matter its wielder, no enemy will get a clean blow.
The tip of this massive spear was carved from the horn of the very first Stegadon to bear a war howdah.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Chain Lightning"

colour_text: When this sword is unsheathed, a strange buzzing hum is heard forewarning the bearer of his enemy's attack.
Brought to the world by the Old Ones, this weapon shimmers in and out of existence, severing the souls of anything living it touches.
The sword of swords, created by the Skaven to destroy the greatest Necromancer to ever walk the world. It is a doomed thing.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Vampire Counts

colour_text: This weapon is inlaid with a thousand tiny barbed teeth, that still require feeding!
Forged from the metal of a fallen star, this weapon's graceful lines belie the formidable power it grants its wielder.
A legendary blade forged by Aren, one of the first Swordmasters of Hoeth. It is as tall as an Elf and as light as a willow switch.
Quenched in the poison of a thousand malicious serpents; when it strikes, poison flows into the veins of its victims.
This weapon is attached to a Warp-generator that channels crackling energy along its blade.
Warpstone powder mixed with steel during the forging process creates a weapon of wicked cutting prowess.
This weapon weeps a corrosive venom that can melt through armour to help deliver the poisoned point.

ui_effects.localised_text: ➖ High chance opponent will resist damage

colour_text: Whenever the God of the Savage Hunt's name is invoked blood shall flow, one way or another.
Bretonnian dragon slayer blade
Axe crafted by Grimnir

effects.description: Passive ability: "Beast Armour of Karond Kar"

enabled_if: Enemy with entity size large in ability range

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

colour_text: Some Marauders walk openly within the lands of other races, not seen as a threat but a northern foreigner - a barbarian. But they are wrong, he is a threat.
There are many monsters in the northern wastes - creatures that will eat a man no matter which god he worships. A tribe's Beast Tamer can bring such monsters to heel… if he has the talent.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for war beast units
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: Some nobles of the mortal nations - the rich ones - take to buying antiquities and cursed items. Their ignorance in unearthing such relics is our ally.
The servants of Chaos are more than the barbarous Northmen - throughout the mortal realms secret cults worship the true Gods, and so our plans advance.
Said to have come from the ruins of Mordheim, Darksouls do not age and await the return of the Daemons that once possessed them.
"Listen brave men of the Empire - pray! But not to Sigmar, he cares not for YOU. There are other Gods who are willing to answer your prayers..."

effects.description:
Income from all horde buildings: +4%
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: Huscarls are Norse tribesmen that honourably serve their Chieftain - a manservant and shieldbearer both.
The Kurgan are a tribe that could end all others - such are their numbers. Best keep this Chieftain as an ally.
The Magister - or whatever name a cult leader abides by - is a powerful, covert agent of Chaos, tending to flocks of the corrupted within the mortal lands.
Mutants are shunned by so-called civilised societies but welcomed by the tribes of the north... and their omnipotent patrons.
"Stroke, stroke - keep up or I'll feed yer to the Blood God's hounds!"

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 when attacking at sea
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: There are souls that have been truly blessed by the Gods - not quite Spawn - but have received many gifts nonetheless.
The Slave Master takes the thralls taken on the raids and prepares them for bloody sacrifice or, even worse, a grisly life of servitude.
"I am my master's tool - my God's vessel. Use me!"
A crude effigy and shamanic heirloom from one of the hag trees that grow deep in the forest.
A potent sacrificial tool that radiates the wrath of a thousand different offerings to the Dark Gods.
The bleached skull of the long-dead Great Bray-Shaman, Rarkos, is mounted upon the bearer's staff.
This staff, and wielder, are crawling with bugs and other nasties that can be sent forth on a whim.
This battered suit of ramshackle plate mail is covered with the soot from man's burned palaces and temples.
A rotting pelt, shrouded in dark tendrils of malice that only the bravest or foolish should wear.
A headdress with two great ram horns that meld into the wearer's own, allowing him to deliver a devastating head-butt!
This ancient suit of chainmail can counter the fanciful enchantments and magicks of enemy blades.
Trollhide confers some of the more gruesome abilities of its former occupant to the wearer!
When this ancient, fossilised horn is sounded a cloud of disarray falls upon the enemy but emboldens the Gors.
A sliver of strangely glowing stone that when cast to the ground will generate a tremendous gust of magical wind.
As a speaker of spells and caster of magicks, a Bray-Shaman can summon a magical servant to aid him in his darkling duties.
This hound doesn't reside with the others, it remains close to the Chieftain, a dangerous pet desperate to please its master.
Female Beastmen are rare. Oft-timid beasts, they carry the true-horn's seed and mother the next generation.
This Gor is skilled with flint knife able to separate skin from flesh, whether the subject is dead or still breathing.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +12%

colour_text: This harpy is loyal to the Chieftain, and will break through the tree canopy to fly high and spy out the land.
Some Gors are tasked to look after the Herdstones, their reward oft-being sacrifice at the stone they kept in life.
Some Beastmen are mongrels with minor mutations. Though they live their pathetic lives amongst men, their true loyalty is to the herd.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Men
	(Hero's army)

colour_text: Nurgors are diseased Beastmen with rotting horns and blemished skin, oft-shunned by the herd and sent to bring ruin.
Chaos Spawn are not easy to control and corral, but some Gors are deft at doing just that.
This scrawny Ungor is kept collared and close to the Chieftain - attending his needs, carrying his food, getting kicked and beaten.
This banner takes the form of a legendary standard torn from the grip of its dying owner and desecrated.

This ancient banner is stitched together with sinew from the skins of defeated enemies.
A jagged spike with the corroded remains of armoured warriors impaled; this totem spreads an aura of entropy.
The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.

Made from the skull of a geomancer - when filled with soil, the chalice can summon a deluge of blood-soaked mud.
These cursed items are all manner of blasphemy, from skulls of dead priests to hallowed, torn branches of Loren.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +1 for Bray-Shamans
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: The Axe of Men is so-called because it hacks through men as easily as other, lesser axes, hew timber.

colour_text: When the Banebeast Khorgor was finally slain, his powerful, half-sentient axes went missing shortly after.
This infamous blade bears a potent blood magick - even a slight cut will erupt in a geyser of gore.
Made to fell the Mammuts of the far north, this spear bears enchantments that allow it to penetrate deep into flesh.
Mangelder saps the strength of mind as well as body. It is a weapon rightly feared across the Old World.
Draw your strength from the enemy’s courage; strike with equal power.
Scourge is a lethal whip, thirsty for blood and wrapped in the bitter curses of many generations of Bray-Shamans.
A great, blunt weapon with an iron beast-head at its tip - a symbol of the Beastmen's desire to unmake all.
The Brass Cleaver is said to be an artefact from another realm - ancient and terrible, it thirsts for blood.
Made from the shards of Elven weapons, this set of splintered blades fits over the user's own talons.
This decrepit tome bristles with dark secrets and eldritch powers. Reading from it summons dark thoughts and grim deeds.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Wind of Death"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Wind of Death Upgraded"

Hero recruit rank: +5 for Necromancers
	(all provinces)

colour_text: This small idol shimmers with an eerie green light, bestowing unnatural regenerative powers upon the wearer.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Warrior Priests
	(all provinces)

colour_text: An ancestral ring, set with a gem of deep, sanguine claret that has granted the von Carsteins everlasting Undeath.
This accursed blade drinks deep of its victim's blood, restoring vigour and strength to the one who brandishes it.
This stave is imbued with the right to lead, so that power and authority pervades its holder.
The last relic of Gwynthraul's legendary quest; any who wear it are charged with his renowned strength and vigour.
These arrows shower their targets with dozens of razor-sharp shards; a percussive shot of death.
When this ancient and revered relic is blown, all Elven forces are driven to the Hunt with a savage determination.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

colour_text: In a forest, there is no finer spy than a tree.
The eldest of Athel Loren's scouts have visited areas of the forest their younger counterparts do not yet know exist.
Commanders of the Eternal Guard; the finest of the finest.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 for Eternal Guard units
	(own army)

colour_text: A spirit of Athel Loren, while incorporeal, can be sensed by all who dwell within its Waystone bounds.
A trusty hawk is its handler's eyes in the sky, scouting for danger.
A loyal hound, tried, tested and as much a killer as any bow-armed Elf.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%

colour_text: Those who march under the banner of the Hunter King and his Eternal Queen do so with true meaning in every step.
An outbreak of fire in the forest is generally a bad thing, but not when this one is forging the finest weapons, however.
Sometimes even the forest's chosen warriors wish their approach to be signalled; it's psychology in action.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Wardancer and Bladesinger units
	(own army)

colour_text: Forest dwellers beware, lest you are watched, followed and taken, never to be seen again.

onscreen_name: The Banner of the Eternal Queen
colour_text: Those who go to battle with the Everqueen's personally hand-woven banner do so proudly, and never waver.

	(assigned unit)

onscreen_name: The Banner of the Hunter King
colour_text: Though tattered and ancient, this banner causes forces to charge - in the name of the Hunt - before the main Elven host.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Banner of the Hunter King"
	(assigned unit)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

colour_text: This cloak, renewed annually by Ariel herself, is all Orion needs to protect himself.
Forged from a Khainite shard by the greatest Elven smith, this weapon can break through even the firmest of armours.
This blade, like Durthu himself, is steeped in millennia of bitterness and rage waiting to be unleashed.
When Orion hurls this living weapon with fierce purpose it fells the most powerful foes before returning to its master.

ui_effects.localised_text: ➖ Can cause damage to friendly combatants

colour_text: Made with a single, pristine hair from Queen Ariel, the Bow of Loren is a weapon without peer.
This crystal-forged blade cuts through more than flesh - it feasts on the soul, leaving wounds that never heal.
Once a Shaman, now a beast transformed by Wurrzag and retained as an example of Da Great Green Prophet's might.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Shamans
	(all provinces)

colour_text: This shield is inscribed with powerful runes of protection that turn away even the most rending of blows.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

colour_text: This gnarled and fearsome visor is riddled with eerie power which emanates from its bored-out eye sockets.
When the leering yellow face of the Bad Moon Banner rises, all Night Goblins swell with an insane blend of daring and battle-madness!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

colour_text: Bright and angry glow the Runes of Fury, the weapons that hold them almost jumping out of their wielders' hands in desperation to strike the foe.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

colour_text: A Dwarf wielding a weapon bearing the Runes of Might can fell a Giant in a flurry of axe blows.
A weapon with this rune moves to block incoming attacks, making its wielder extremely hard to hit.
The Rune of Striking causes the weapon to hit the foe’s most vulnerable area with an uncanny precision.
Covered in magical glyphs, this staff protects Wurrzag from the many magical machinations ranged against him.
Skarsnik's pointed staff, pulsating with magical energy, channels the might of Gork (or Mork) to lance out with weird, terrifying power.
Soaked in centuries of Greenskin blood, the Ironhammer has been handed down to every rightful Angrund ruler of the Eight Peaks.
The pellet with the poison is in the vessel with the pestle; the chalice from the palace has the brew that is true…

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Damsels
	(all provinces)

colour_text: These enchanted plates channel sunlight, so beams of light burst forth to blind the foe as the wearer approaches.
Although madder than a bag of exceptionally angry wasps, Gurdilloue forged this breastplate to instil luck and accuracy in its wearer.
This breastplate, inscribed with the Grail Vow, knits otherwise mortal wounds together so its wearer can fight another day.
Blessed by each of the Grail Companions, this shield ensures its bearer does not age whilst carrying it to war and quest.
A priceless artefact, this triptych of the Lady ingrains the faith to defeat most magical attacks ranged against its bearer.
When woven within a living horse’s mane, hair from Gille’s steed confers strength and resilience into mounts of the same noble bloodline.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +25% for cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: These wafers are blessed by the Lady, causing throes of ecstasy and religious visions to flood the mind when eaten.
The interlocking pattern adorning this banner has the power to stop almost anything in its tracks, even a cannonball.
Great zeal and god-like strength are infused within those who bear this well-travelled banner, ensuring they fight like heroes of yore.
This banner, embroidered with nymphs’ hair, enables the unit beneath to blend with its surroundings and pass through solid objects.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit ignores speed and combat penalties caused by terrain and can move through trees.

colour_text: Glorious thoughts consume Knights who ride ‘neath this enchanted banner, enabling them to take on much larger forces than their own.
Malgrimace’s claw has been enchanted by Damsels, enabling its bearer to walk through fire and emerge entirely unharmed.
When worn directly above the heart, this locket gifts the Damsel Sirienne’s suitors with the protection of the Lady.
The Knight who prays beside water before battle may see the Lady’s hand emerge, offering a perfect blade to her noble champion.
Passed down from Knight to Knight, this hefty blade requires a hand-and-a-half to wield it correctly.

onscreen_name: The Silver Lance of the Blessed
colour_text: Forged by Gilles the Uniter himself, this lance instantly turns all but the purest, bravest souls to fire.
Fearnought’s lance allows its bearer to breath fire upon enemies whenever the name of the slain Dragon, Malifex, is uttered.
The Sea God’s rage is channelled through the trident’s prongs, smashing his enemies like waves against the rocks.

effects.description:
Attrition: -75% casualties suffered from high seas attrition
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +12 when attacking at sea
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: Morkar was first of the Everchosen; his armour is charged with Ruinous power and caked with the blood of many thousands of victims.
This fine casque was once worn by an expert looter; somehow, some part of his natural instincts remain.
This armour was once worn by one who was either exalted to Champion-status or who fell in battle, but not before attracting the Dark Powers' attention.
The thick, blubbering hide of the Mammoth, although heavy, provides excellent protection for the wearer against arrow and blades alike.
The impossibly-harsh climate in which the Frost-Wyrms live ensures their scales bolster armour's effectiveness whilst burning any foe who touches them with intense cold.
Each egg contains deadly spiderlings, to swarm over and bite the foe's body, injecting deadly venom into the wounds.

ui_effects.localised_text: ➕ Summons a unit of Spider Hatchlings

colour_text: The impossibly-harsh climate in which the Frost-Wyrms live ensures their scales bolster armour's effectiveness whilst burning any foe who touches them with intense cold.
When blown, the Great Horn calls up a thunderstorm which forces the bearer's enemies back with high winds and lightning strikes.
Anyone who tries to slay a Manticore and lives to tell the tale must be braver than he looks.
Disgusting as it may be, a shot of Troll blood is just the thing to bolster the drinker's courage, causing an unstoppable bloodlust to rise within them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

colour_text: This absolute nutter is even a match for most other berserkers, such is his unrestrained axe-rage. Have him on *your* side, yeah?

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 for Marauder Berserker units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Marauder Berserker units
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: From one of the seven dominant tribes of Norsca, this abject fiend attracts better-than-average Skin Wolves to the pack... and the hunt that surely follows.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for all Skin Wolf, Norscan Ice Wolves & Norscan Warhound units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for all Skin Wolf, Wolves & Warhound units
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: A wild and unruly beast of a man, good in a fight and… well, that's about it.
"Conditions are going to be pretty harsh, and the pay will vary depending on performance, but you do get to look at them... Fight well, kill plenty, and you might get to touch."
These battle-hardened, merciless warriors are experts in sacking, looting, and the carnage that ensues. Plunder and killings are their reasons to be.
"I am the strongest - I am the one… and my wares are the finest you'll see around these parts, I'll wager!"
It is no easy task to secure the cooperation of such a large, hairy, foul smelling beast; the same can be said of the mammoths this man tames.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -10% for Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +1 for Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: Spectacularly brutal and lacking even the faintest glimmer of mercy, this one is well on the road to be noticed by the ever-fickle Chaos Gods.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all Marauder units
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: While some peaks of the Norscan mountain ranges remain impassable, this man has traversed those that can be crossed.
This one tends a shrine to one of the Ruinous Powers, braving their unpredictable cruelty and random transformation to guide the Norse warriors to exaltation.

Considering it's definitely never been cleaned, this decayed tooth is surprisingly strong; when it pierces skin the poison seeps in. Death tends to follow soon after.
He who wears this ring is respected by everyone around him, whether he deserves it or not…
This beautiful green emerald has been imbued with powerful healing incantations of the Cult of Shallya.
A useful thing - easily concealed and with a power that surprises whomever sees it in action.

This arcane tome, bound in ancient dragon hide, contains much wisdom on the conjuring and subjugation of spells.

colour_text: The Armour of Destiny is worn by a great Hero among every generation, their fate entwined with the ensorcelled suit.
Those who don the Armour of Fortune seem to have the favour of Ranald, able to parry the lethal blow with a lucky deflection.
Bashed out of the blackest metals of the underground together with the reforged suits of slain stunties, this armour is thick, heavy and said to be blessed by Gork. Well… he spat on it anyway.
The gleaming, all-encasing suit of silver is light but still grants the wearer a heavy degree of protection - surely, the hallmarks of Elven artifice.
A product of twisted sorcery, this construct fuses with the wearer, giving him tremendous endurance.
By the grace of Gork (or Mork), Azhag’s magical armour is so ‘ard, it can even protect those around him.
The cooling of this armour in the blood of Dwarf Runesmiths has imbued it with great powers – some explosive in nature!

ui_effects.localised_text: ➕ Explosion does not affect friendly troops

colour_text: An ornate helm fashioned in the style of dragon scales, allowing the wearer to shrug off burning flame and bolts of fire.
Such a shield has been enchanted by a Wizard or blessed by a Priest to give its wearer greater protection.
Ranald, the God of Thieves, Tricksters and Gamblers has blessed the armour and those who are willing to take a chance.
To rid Karak Hirn of two despicable giants, Borek fashioned this suit of exquisite Gromril armour that glows with several master runes.
Discovered in a vault deep inside Castle Drachenfels, the aura of gloom that clings to the Nightshroud is so strong it physically manifests as armour.
First discovered in the far south by tomb raiders, the Shield of Ptolos grants the wielder a great defensive boon against missile attacks.
This shield is branded with wards of arcane protection, it has had many owners in its storied past.
Forged from a rare star-metal, it is said that no mortal blade can piece the Armour of Meteoric Iron.
Once belonging to the First Everchosen of Chaos, this ancient suit of Chaos Armour is as powerful as those who have dared to wear it.
Protected by powerful runes, the Armour of Skaldour has turned countless blades away from the High King in both battle and during assassination attempts.
King Louen carries the shield that has been worked on by Bretonnia’s greatest artisans and enchanted by Prophetesses to become a mighty artefact.
This majestic, horned helmet has been worn by every Slayer King since the time of King Baragor.

The hated face of Lordly imposition.
The rivers of the Empire are vital arteries of communication and commerce.
In a major metropolis, it's all too easy to end up with a knife in your back.
The lone Bounty Hunter can go places that ungainly military units cannot.
These hearty souls brave the Sea of Claws in small craft, despite the constant threat of pirates and raiders.
Obtaining corpses legally is quite difficult, you know…

Many Kossars leave the constant wars of their homeland to become mercenaries and adventurers elsewhere.
When the war never ends, there is always a need for fighting men.
Even a small amount of training can be the difference between life and death on the blood-soaked battlefields of the Old World.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

colour_text: Men fight better when their livelihood, not just their lives, is at stake.
"Rob from the rich and give to the poor. That's the theory, anyway."
Experienced outdoorsmen who reconnoitre for armies, caravans, and other travelling parties. Life expectancy is short.
"Professional bully wanted. Fair prices paid for beating the right people up."

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +12%

colour_text: Never do an honest day's work if you can avoid it.
For the scullion, stable boy, and serving wench, escape from their hard lives often seems impossible - because generally it is.
Although illegal, most folks don't think much of cutting a few corners in the name of good business.
Full-time, paid professionals to man the fortresses, patrol the borders, and repel invaders.
In the criminal underworld, strength and viciousness are highly-prized virtues.
Collecting money for the government is a thankless job. Doing so in the midst of the wilderness is practically a death sentence…
Bodies are two-a-penny; the valuables buried with them are worth much, much more.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Vampire Counts
	(Hero's army)

colour_text: Who wants to wake up in the same village or city every day, doing the same thing as yesterday? No? Thought not.
Responsible for the grooming, wardrobe, and presentation of their charges, a valet is indispensable for the style-conscious noble.
Whatever their case, nothing is left for these men and women but religion - and the swift dispatch of the minions of evil and Chaos.
From history to anatomy to science to nothing more than the bottom of a bottle…
The fool dressed in motley - a symbol of Bretonnia as much as the Grail.
As Knights in training, squires assist their masters on and off the field of battle.
The keepers of the archive know the location of any account, history or lore held within the Dwarfhold's dusty archives.
"The king be damned - every Dawi knows there is no more important a personage in this Hold than the Brewmaster!"

effects.description:

	(local region)

colour_text: Dwarf candle makers are always in demand. If you live underground you'll need light no matter the time of day - even if your eyes are suited to darkness.
A typical choirmaster's conundrum is how many verses of "She was Only a Halfling's Daughter" to regale the Elven ambassador with? The full 260? Or the shorter 180 stanza version?
"What do you mean the Coopers' Guild isn't important? Tell me, lad, without our casks what would you store the black powder and beer in?"

effects.description:
Income from Gem Cutters and Obsidian Quarries: +6%
	(local region)

A Dwarf bride often comes with a hefty dowry - by tradition her weight in gold. Which probably explains why hot-blooded Dwarfs take to curvier maids!
The ability to etch runes into Dwarf flesh will keep the spirit of the Karaz Ankor alive and well.
Dwarfs can manipulate and shape gold as easy as wet clay, and Goldsmiths are masters of this craft.

effects.description:

effects.description:

Communication between Dwarfholds is important. As such, these young Dwarfs risk life and limb to carry messages from one to another.
Even for Dwarfs, Runesmiths are a grim sort; they very rarely take on aspirants, as worthy apprentices are hard to find.

effects.description:

colour_text: Those beardlings who slight their masters or fail in their apprenticeships may take the Slayer Oath in shame.

effects.description:

	(local region)

"There's lost treasure down here, alright. Gold or gems, one or t'other. My beard can sense it. Just gotta mind those booby traps…"
Dwarfs who have been disgraced, crossed in love, or otherwise humiliated abandon traditional society and seek the sweet release of death. Fair enough, really.
Whose skills include aggressive leaflet campaigns, rousing speeches, and generally stirring things up a bit…
Humans born with magical talent are dangerous and feared individuals.
Who provides painful but effective healing to the common folk of the Empire.
"Any old iron? No? What about rags or bones?"
The glue that holds urban society together.
No army travels alone. Who else would cook, sew or loot the freshly slain?
Wood is burned to create charcoal, an important fuel for the Winter months.
The coachman risks life and limb to bring passengers and cargo safely through the hazards of the Imperial roadways.
Some do it for the roar of the crowd and others for the money.
The bravest Estalians travel to the Empire to test their rapiers against worthy opponents.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for Crossbowmen and Spearmen units
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: Ferrymen make their living moving people and goods across the Empire's rivers, for a small fee of course.
It takes skill to stalk wild animals while avoiding the dark creatures of the woods.
The Empire is a nation of laws, and therefore also a nation of jails.
The acolytes of the Light College channel cleansing Light Magic for their masters.
Ship-borne soldiers, marines protect their vessels from pirates, Norse marauders, and other raiders.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from high seas attrition
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: With great distances separating the important cities and castles of the Empire, messengers are an indispensable means of communication.
The younger children of noble houses must often make their own way in the world, amongst the lower classes, adventurers, and ne'er-do-wells.
"Ooooo master, there's some lovely filth over here…"
It’s a dirty job, but it helps keep the plague away.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: These lawmen patrol the roads and tracks of the Empire, protecting travellers and their goods.
Some scribes tire of reading about the adventures of others and resolve to have some of their own.
On blood-soaked decks, seamen earn their rum ration and their booty.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from high seas attrition
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: Honest, hard-working citizens? Thieves are dedicated to taking as much of their money as possible.
Skilled labourers and craftsmen are an important part of the Empire's economy.
Responsible for maintaining law and order, Watchmen are empowered to make arrests and fight fires where necessary.
Among the mighty forests of the Empire, Woodsmen look after the trees they will fell for timber.
Don't like some git? Then send in a backstabba, they're like nasty skulkers, but even meaner.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +8%

colour_text: "I'm gonna fly! Do da loop-de-loop! Watch me goooo!"
Marsh-gobbos, or "boggarts", know all the "secret ways" in marshy, swampy areas. However, they're still "smelly gits" according to the Orcs.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -20% for Goblin and Night Goblin units
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: Orc bullies are irascible, infirm and often incontinent old warriors who boss the war machine crews around.
Mounted on a giant shaggy wolf, this Goblin is a grizzled veteran, having run away from countless enemies in his time.
Greenskin encampments are often dominated by piles of poo. It's a useful material for daubing and throwing. The dung shovela has the "top job" of pilling it all up.
Greenskins don't have clergy in the normal sense, but some gobbos like to "preach" the will of da godz.
Those idols of Gork 'n' Mork that appear around Greenskin camps? Someone 'as to carve 'em!
Orcs like a good scrap in the local fighting pit. The pit boss sets up the fights and "keeps it all within da rulez".
"Grrrr, we gonna get da zoggin gits! Get me prodda!"

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -15% for Savage Orc units
	(local province)

colour_text: All gobbos are sneak-thieves, but this one has elevated stripping the dead of their valuables into an art form.
Orc Shamans rarely mix with others, unless when dancin' around the campfire. A lackey is there to fetch and carry for the Shaman and keep his interactions with the boyz to a minimum.

effects.description:
Hero recruitment cost: -8% for Shamans
	(local province)

colour_text: It's not just Night Goblins that like fungus, all Greenskins do. 'Shroom gatheras go and get 'em - those that survive Squig attacks, that is.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

colour_text: Last in the queue behind the Orcs and Goblins when it comes to lootin', Snotlings will steal whatever they get their grubby little hands upon, ensuring nothing of value remains.
The many-faceted eyes of the Feaster From Beyond demand worship, or He will not send his broodlings to serve.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

colour_text: A spheroid body with beady eyes and gaping, many-toothed maw, this Squig has doubtful merits as a pet but works wonders intimidating gobbos into obedience (or just eating them).

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 for Goblin and Night Goblin units
	(Lord's army)

colour_text: "See dis? I'm gonna nick it, cos I'm a bit weeeey!"
Trolls are stupid, that is a fact. So Orc troll herderz are employed to get the dumb gits where they're meant to be.

effects.description:

	(local province)

colour_text: Halflings patrol the borders of the Moot, keeping away threats from unwanted outsiders.
A grim, northern land, full of Ice Trolls, Chaos Spawn, and a breed of tough fighters.
Cats are generally seen as lucky in the Empire, but black cats are said to be the familiars of warlocks and witches.
Carrion are large, Undead, vulture-like creatures that are drawn to battlefields and Unholy summonings.
Corpses not interned in Morr's gardens straight away often find themselves on the black market.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +8%

colour_text: "Come, child, come visit my modest hovel - it's just around the corner and there's cakes in the oven!"

effects.description:

	(local province)

colour_text: "Yes, master?"
This thing has no mind, it is a fleshy contraption powered by its master's will, used for mundane tasks and guarding the castle during daylight.
"Pass me ma spade, I'm lookin' for gallows bait!
Many Vampire Lords keep a mortal manservant around. After all, someone needs to dust the drapes.
There are foolish mortals - usually rich, noble, dilettante types - who crave immortality and will be a Vampire's willing spy for the chance of damnation.
Those spirits who are no longer bound to the mortal plane, but have thus far avoided Morr's grasp, can be tethered to a Vampire's service - for poltergeists have their uses...
"Speculum, speculum on the wall, who is the cruellest of them all?"
While they started off as destitute nobles of Stirland, since becoming Undead the von Carsteins have accumulated great wealth. The treasurer is in charge of the master's vaults.

effects.description:
Income from Vampire Crypts and Vampire Keeps: +8%
	(local region)

colour_text: Warlocks are those that practise the dark arts away from the overseers in the Colleges of Magic. They are the prey of Witch Hunters and more…

The Rampager’s Standard is so-called as those that wield it in battle are always the most desperate to cross the field and charge the enemy!
The Ranger’s Standard grants beings under its banner the agility and the wherewithal to scout ahead of the enemy.

The arcane sigils woven into the fabric of the banner blaze brightly in the presence of metal, altering heavy, cumbersome armour, making it as light as a feather.
When the leering yellow face of the Bad Moon Banner rises, all Night Goblins swell with an insane blend of daring and battle-madness!
Those who walk under the Wailing Banner know that their enemies will quiver in fear, for the dread face upon the banner wails and moans - instilling terror!

colour_text: During the Golden Age, a Rune of Battle would be seen on Dwarf Banners from many Holds, for the Clans were always thirsty for war.
Those that have the Rune of Courage will never fear the horrors they face.

colour_text: Dwarfs are stubborn. The Rune of Stoicism amplifies this, reminding them never to back down no matter who they face.

colour_text: This ancient rune of protection was first fashioned by the Ancestor Goddess Valaya herself.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

colour_text: Bright and angry glow the Runes of Fury, the weapons that hold them almost jumping out of their wielders' hands in desperation to strike the foe.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

colour_text: A Dwarf wielding a weapon bearing the Runes of Might can fell a Giant in a flurry of axe blows.
A weapon with this rune moves to block incoming attacks, making its wielder extremely hard to hit.
The Rune of Striking causes the weapon to hit the foe’s most vulnerable area with an uncanny precision.
Troops that bear this rune are not restricted by the bounds of their army's deployment zone.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

colour_text: This ancient Elven heirloom glows with protective energies that become increasingly more powerful in the presence of evil sorcery.
A precious stone that glows at the break of every dawn, its bearer is said to be protected by an invisible field.
This cloak is made from the skin of the fierce dragon Fyrskar - now an heirloom of Karak Kadrin and a symbol of vows already fulfilled.
The Dragonbane Gem was found in the gullet of the legendary drake, Helorgondrax. The beast had choked on the stone in mid-flight and crashed into a Halfling feasting hall at supper time.
Those that carry the Luckstone are said to cheat fate, for a time at any rate.
This jet-black amulet is said to contain a bound djinn, who will deflect enemy magic.
The lodestone of pure obsidian contains many dark djinn, imprisoned by a sultan-sorcerer whose name is lost to time. It is a powerful anti-magic artefact.
The barest essence of a djinn, captured within black obsidian, is enough to weaken enemy spells.
Those that wear the Talisman of Endurance can tolerate wounds and pain and suffering far in excess of mortal norms.
The gleaming Talisman of Preservation gives its wearer the ability to shrug off mortal wounds.
This is a silver talismanic device worn on a chain that is said to deflect killing blows or sure-striking arrows on occasion.
The Dragon Crown has been worn by the High King since the founding of Karaz-a-Karak.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

Recruit rank: +1 for Longbeards units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

colour_text: Named after the Tzeentchian Sorcerer who discovered it, the Eye sees nearly all. Its current owner should make use of its prophetic powers...
Created by the warrior mage, Fredrik von Tarnus, the Silver Seal wards away harmful blows and fell sorceries.

effects.description: Passive ability: "The White Cloak of Ulric"

colour_text: A massive axe bathed in the spiteful magicks of the Night Goblins, it is a weapon to bring home all their curses upon the stunties.

The infamous event known as Ragnarork will see the world destroyed in an orgy of fire and slaughter at the hands of the Greenskins. This is rumoured to be the axe that will kick it all off. Best swing it with caution… or not!
This blade constantly drips with blood as if only just pulled from a corpse - those that wield it scream with rage, demanding to feed the sword its next victim.
The jagged edge of the biting blade ensures that even the strongest armour struggles to repel this weapon.
An enchanted duo of blades - one long and one short - give the wielder a dazzling array of skilful moves, to parry and deceive an opponent.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

colour_text: A massive sword that is still surprisingly versatile to use in combat. Nevertheless, when it strikes it can cleave a foe in twain.
This golden sword gifts its user with a foresight and speed in combat that no mortal should ever have.
A blade made of darkest obsidian with an edge that is said to not exist in this mortal plane - no armour can stand against it.
The Ogre Blade was used by Chaos Dwarfs to tame the kingdoms amongst the Mountains of Mourn. How it came to the Old World is a mystery.

onscreen_name: Red Axe of Karak Eight Peaks
colour_text: The Red Axe was forged in Karak Eight Peaks, its vengeful runes made to destroy all Greenskins and vermin.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +12% when fighting against Greenskins
Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Greenskins

colour_text: The Relic Sword was discovered in an ancient barrow close to the swamps of Mourkain. There are not many beings that can shrug off a wound from this blade.
This blade was stolen from a Tomb Banshee while she sang a haunting nursery tale to a forgotten child. Now the blade sings too, and shrieks when it strikes a foe.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

colour_text: Slagga’s crude twin blades don’t just enable Azhag to enthusiastically slash up anyone who gets close, but also motivate da boyz to follow suit.
It is said Prince Sigvald’s ornate sword is forged from a sliver of Slaanesh’s own blade.
Imbued with the quiddity of Ruin, Morghur's gnarled staff summons deadly Chaos Spawn to do his bidding on the battlefield.

ui_effects.localised_text: ➕ Summons a unit of Chaos Spawn

colour_text: The Sword of Battle is a battered weapon, yet its many owners always remark upon how easy it is to wield in a fight.
A sword tinged red, for wherever it is swung bloodshed is guaranteed, with multiple foes falling in a single deadly arc.
The Sword of Might is a grand blade in a rich pommel that imbues its owners with a boon of strength in the heat of battle.
The Sword of Strife never has an owner for long, for those who wield it will always find it in their hand when their temper rises.
Found in the hands of a long-dead guardian, this sword guides its user, making them a much better fighter.
A sword of silver that never dims. When used in anger, the sword arm of its owner darts forth before an opponent can even raise their guard.
Before Grimnir disappeared into the north, he gifted his son Morgrim one of his legendary axes. It has been passed down to each High King ever since.
Replicated by Runesmiths from a single scale wedged between the teeth of a slain Chaos Lord at the pivotal Battle of Thraag, the White Dwarf's armour is able to deflect even the hardest blows.
Long thought lost to time and conflict, Grombrindal's awesome helm inspires already-courageous Dwarfen hearts to even greater acts of bravery.

colour_text: A Dwarf wielding a weapon bearing the Runes of Might can fell a Giant in a flurry of axe blows.
A weapon with this rune moves to block incoming attacks, making its wielder extremely hard to hit.
The Rune of Striking causes the weapon to hit the foe’s most vulnerable area with an uncanny precision.
Grombrindal's cloak was woven by Valaya herself as a token of the love she felt for the White Dwarf, as proven by the skill in needlework displayed.
Mentioned in several sagas and legends, could the White Dwarf's mighty weapon be the fabled rune axe wielded by Grimnir at the dawn of history?
The life essence of many wretched, innocent smallfolk ensures that those who drink from this cursed cup thrive with newfound power.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero
